alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Franklin (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 16 at 2:21AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Arkansas and west central Arkansas, including the following counties, in northwest Arkansas, Crawford. In west central Arkansas, Franklin. * WHEN...Until 530 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 219 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated another band of heavy rain producing thunderstorms is moving across Crawford and Franklin counties. This is in addition to heavy rains pickup up from earlier storms, in the 2 to 3 inch range by radar estimates. As a result, minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Van Buren... Ozark... Cedarville... Mountainburg... Natural Dam... Alma... Mulberry... Dyer... Altus... Denning... Chester... Rudy... Wiederkehr Village... Fern... Lake Fort Smith... Cass... Lee Creek... Figure Five... Concord... Piney... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
